bwwExcerpt: Sondheim himself, in Finishing the Hat, has called the show 'crippled by its size, ambition and mysteriousness, and thus always worth the effort of experimentation.' Director Eric Schaeffer has opted mostly to steer the ship, not re-install the keel, and, as far as I can tell (which, to be honest, isn’t very far), he and choreographer Warren Carlyle have preserved the spirit of Michael Bennett’s original hoofery...Follies is the disease and the cure in one package: I'd advise you to catch it.
